problem.markdown:
>>Which city in Texas has the most total sales (highest revenue)?<< ( ) San Antonio (x) Houston ( ) Austin ( ) Dallas
>>Which city in New York has the least total sales (lowest revenue)?<< (x) Arkport ( ) Clayton ( ) Tivoli ( ) Ripley
>>How many cities the State of New York have sales (Revenue)? (Hint: Distinct Count aggregation might be useful)<< ( ) 710 ( ) 711 (x) 712 ( ) 713
[explanation] Houston has the most sales in Texas while Arkport has the least sales in New York. You can view this by creating a pivot table using State as Filters, City as Rows, and Sum of Revenue as Values. Then, sort the pivot table by Sum of Revenue and filter accordingly. For the last question, you can replace the Values with Distinct Count of City. [explanation]

div.p: Houston has the most sales in Texas while Arkport has the least sales in New York. You can view this by creating a pivot table using State as Filters, City as Rows, and Sum of Revenue as Values. Then, sort the pivot table by Sum of Revenue and filter accordingly. For the last question, you can replace the Values with Distinct Count of City.
